intro: Oreopanax trollii, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and overharvesting.
